images.caption: Figure 1:Overview of examples from our three experimental setups.Left: Bilingual Self-Loop—A single model iteratively translates a document from English (EN) to French (FR) or Thai (TH) and back to English.Middle: Bilingual Two-Player—Two different models collaborate within the same chain on translating between English and French or English and Thai.Right: Multilingual Multiplayer—A more complex translation chain involving multiple languages and models, designed to examine how increasing the variety of languages and models accelerates information distortion over iterative generations.
